instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S2: What is PP3V3_S2? PP3V3_S2 is a typo of PP3V3_S3.
definitions.PPVOUT_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_LCDBKLT is the backlight power rail that is responsible for creating a backlight o nthe screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no lcd and backlight, lite water damage
threads.message:
small water spot near UC710/QD530
find that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL> - 0.018

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no lcd and backlight, lite water damage
threads.message: Lift LC710 and check where the low resistance remains.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no lcd and backlight, lite water damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no lcd and backlight, lite water damage
threads.message:
Bad news, there are many chips connected.
Injecting voltage will not heat something to find with fingers; an IR cam may help you.

I recommend to remove UC810 first and check if low resistance disappears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no lcd and backlight, lite water damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no lcd and backlight, lite water damage
threads.message:
I was take UL000 out the S2 line now 0.300 and  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL> 3.3v
there is Chime sound but DP800 0V with screen connected of course.
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL> 0V -800 on DP800
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0V 1080 on DP800

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no lcd and backlight, lite water damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> should appear, at least in the first few seonds (when chime).
<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> must go high at same time.
